alert.note: Alert for Allegheny (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 7:30PM EST until February 19 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...Ohio... Allegheny River At CW Bill Young Dam affecting Allegheny County. Wills Creek At Cambridge affecting Guernsey County. Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. PAC003-191600- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.W.0013.000000T0000Z-220219T2100Z/ /ACMP1.1.ER.220218T2200Z.220219T0600Z.220219T1500Z.NO/ 730 PM EST Fri Feb 18 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Allegheny River at CW Bill Young Dam. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.7 feet, Basement flooding begins in New Kensington. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EST Friday was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 17.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning to 13.4 feet and begin rising again early Tuesday morning. It will rise to 13.7 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
